title: Mr. Ong bought some mangoes for Rs. 294, in which 16 of them were rotten, then he sold remaining at 40 percent increase in cost price and profit of Rs. 84. How many mangoes did he buy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ans Let no. of mangoes bought = x C.P of x mangoes = Rs 294 C.P of 1 mango = 294/x C.P of 16 rotten mangoes = ( 294 × 16 ) /x = 4704/x Rs C.P of remaining mangoes =( 294 ) - 4704/x = ( 294x - 4704) / x Now he wants 40 % profit on these remaining mangoes. Therefore S.P of remaining mangoes = 1.4 ( 294x - 4704) /x = ( 411.6x - 6585.6 ) /x Now we know Profit = S.P - C.P 84 = {( 411.6x - 6585.6 ) /x } - ( 294x - 4704 ) /x 84 x = 411.6x - 294 x - 6585.6 + 4704 84 x = 117.6 x - 1881.6 84x - 117.6 x = - 1881.6 -33. 6 x = - 1881.6 x = 1881.6 /33.6 = 56 x = 56 mangoes Ans We can also check the answer C.p of one mango = 294/56 = Rs 5.25 Now 16 mangoes are rotten Therefore remaining mangoes = 56 - 16 = 40 C.P of 40 mangoes = 40 × 5.25 = 210 Profit = 40 % S.P of 40 mangoes = 1.4 × 210 = Rs 294 Difference in S.P and C.P = 294 - 210 = Rs 84 which is same as per given in question.

Let he bought x mangoes for Rs. 294. C.P. = Rs.294. , Cost price of each mango = Rs.294/x. Rotten mangoes =16. Remaining mangoes = (x-16). S.P. of each mango = Rs.294/x.(1+40/100) = Rs.294.(1.4)/x. S.P. of all the remaining mangoes= Rs.294.(1.4).(x-16)/x. S.P. - C.P = profit. 294.(1.4).(x-16)/x - 294 = 84. or. 294.(1.4).(x-16)/x = 378. or , 378.x = 294.(1.4).(x-16). or , 126.x = 98×(14/10).(x-16). or , 9.x = (49/5)×(x-16). or , 49.x - 49×16 = 45.x. or , 4.x = 49×16. => x = (49×16)/4 = 196.
